security_related_code_patterns.description: A hardcoded default AI model name is set globally. While not a secret, this is a configuration that could be environment-dependent.
The code defines regex patterns to DETECT hardcoded passwords (not contain any). This is part of the security scanning functionality.
The code defines regex patterns to DETECT hardcoded API keys (not contain any). This is part of the security scanning functionality.
The code defines regex patterns to DETECT hardcoded tokens (not contain any). This is part of the security scanning functionality.
Defines a prompt instructing the AI to scan for hardcoded secrets. This is a security analysis function, not a secret itself.

summary.notes: No actual hardcoded secrets (API keys, passwords, tokens, private keys, connection strings, or other sensitive data) were found in the source code or configuration files. The codebase contains security scanning patterns and prompts designed to DETECT secrets in analyzed repositories, but does not contain any secrets itself.
summary.recommendation: The codebase is clean with respect to hardcoded secrets. The security scanner in src/engines/security-engine.ts is designed to detect such issues in other projects being analyzed.
